channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-11864] JWTRedirectAuthenticationHandler breaks java8 javadocs
item.description: Jenkins on Java8 is failing as JWTRedirectAuthenticationHandler has <p/> tags in it, something javadoc on java8 considers illegal

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
see https://builds.apache.org/view/H-L/view/Hadoop/job/Hadoop-common-trunk-Java8/173/console

                    ^
/home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/Hadoop-common-trunk-Java8/hadoop-common-project/hadoop-auth/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/security/authentication/server/JWTRedirectAuthenticationHandler.java:62: error: self-closing element not allowed
 * <p/>
   ^

fixing up the undocumented params is something nice; fixing the end tags critical
git log says HADOOP-11717 is where this new file went in
Fixed all the javadoc issues and removed unused parameter.
Thanks, stevel@apache.org - I've attached a patch to address all of those issues.

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.
No tests are needed for this test as it just fixes javadoc errors and removes one unused parameter in a method.
I found some more Common Javadoc error and put up a patch for those at HADOOP-11870, given that this looks like it's already ready.
